result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Willie L. Hopson in court with attorney Jason C. Gonzalez.  Defendant Willie L. Hopson in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss but read in.  Atty. Gonzalez concurs.  Court so dismisses but reads in.

Defendant Willie L. Hopson in court with attorney Jason C. Gonzalez.  Defendant Willie L. Hopson in custody.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matters are resolved (4 cases) and requesting a PSI.  14CF353 to be dismissed based on the plea.  13CF240 and 14CF415 for plea and PSI request.  Br 3 to handle plea.  Bond continues.  Br 2 trial removed from calendar.

Defendant Willie L. Hopson in court with attorney Jason C. Gonzalez.  Defendant Willie L. Hopson in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Reset to 4/6/15  Hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Cover Letter from public defender's office to defendant
Final pre-trial on March 30, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Atty Martinez acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court advises DE of charges/maximum penalties.  Court enters Not Guilty pleas - Set for Trial.  Bond continued.

Defendant Willie L. Hopson in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Martinez states DE will waive prelim today.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.
Preliminary hearing on December 12, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Willie L. Hopson in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Martinez requests prelim.  Time limits cont'd waived.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 12, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

Pre-trial conference on November 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Return date on November 20, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Willie L. Hopson appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Deb ORourke . Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE does qualify for PD representation.  State requests $3000.00 Cash bond.  Atty. ORourke requests PA bond, remained in Sauk Co. for 18 years, no warrants for FTA.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $250.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute Sobriety at all times.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for November 20, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
